trans-unit.source: Defines a content decorator that can stretch and scale a single child to fill the available space.
A Viewbox can only have one <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Viewbox.Child%2A>.
If you add an additional <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Viewbox.Child%2A>, you cause an <xref:System.ArgumentException> at run time.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Viewbox"></xref> class.
Arranges the content of a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Viewbox"></xref> element.
<xref:System.Windows.Controls.Viewbox> always sets its <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Viewbox.Child%2A> to the <xref:System.Windows.UIElement.DesiredSize%2A>.
It then computes and applies a transformation from that <xref:System.Windows.Size> to the available space.

<xref:System.Windows.Controls.Viewbox> determines available space by subtracting the margin of its <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Viewbox.Child%2A> from the input <xref:System.Windows.Size> of its elements.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Size"></xref> this element uses to arrange its child elements.
<xref href="System.Windows.Size"></xref> that represents the arranged size of this <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Viewbox"></xref> element and its child elements.
Gets or sets the single child of a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Viewbox"></xref> element.
If you add an additional child element to a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Viewbox> it causes an <xref:System.ArgumentException> at run time.
The single child of a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Viewbox"></xref> element.
This property has no default value.
Gets a child at the specified index position.
The index position of the wanted <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Visual"></xref> child.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Visual"></xref> child of the parent <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Viewbox"></xref> element.
Gets an enumerator that can iterate the logical children of this <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Viewbox"></xref> element.
An <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator>.
This property has no default value.
Measures the child elements of a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Viewbox"></xref> prior to arranging them during the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.WrapPanel.ArrangeOverride*> pass.
The parent <xref:System.Windows.UIElement> for <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Viewbox> typically calls this method, which performs the first layout pass.
<xref:System.Windows.Controls.Viewbox> measures its child at an infinite `constraint`, allowing the child to be as large as it requires.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Size"></xref> limit that <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Viewbox"></xref> cannot exceed.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Size"></xref> that represents the element size you want.
Gets or sets the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Viewbox"></xref><xref href="System.Windows.Media.Stretch"></xref> mode, which determines how content fits into the available space.
## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`||
A <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Stretch"></xref> that determines how content fits in the available space.
The default is <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Stretch"></xref>.
Gets or sets the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.StretchDirection"></xref>, which determines how scaling is applied to the contents of a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Viewbox"></xref>.
This property determines the scaling restrictions that apply to the contents of a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Viewbox>.
For example, use this property to prevent the contents of a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Viewbox> from being smaller or larger than its original size.
## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`||
A <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.StretchDirection"></xref> that determines how scaling is applied to the contents of a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Viewbox"></xref>.
The default is <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.StretchDirection"></xref>.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Viewbox.StretchDirection*> dependency property.
To be added.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Viewbox.Stretch*> dependency property.
To be added.
Gets the number of child <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Visual"></xref> objects in this instance of <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Viewbox"></xref>.
This property always returns 1.
The number of <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Visual"></xref> children.
